global_fires_2023.title: Global Wildfire Crisis 2023
global_fires_2023.description: A journey through the devastating wildfires that swept across multiple continents in 2023

steps.narration: Our story begins in the boreal forests of northern Canada, where unprecedented fires consumed over 500,000 hectares.
Meanwhile, Europe experienced extreme heat waves with temperatures exceeding 45°C, creating perfect conditions for fires.
Storm Daniel brought devastating floods to Libya, demonstrating the extreme weather patterns affecting our planet.

conclusion.title: Climate Patterns Revealed
conclusion.text: These events illustrate the interconnected nature of global climate systems and the increasing frequency of extreme weather events.

temperature_extremes_2024.title: Temperature Extremes of 2024
temperature_extremes_2024.description: Exploring the record-breaking temperatures and heat events that defined 2024

steps.narration: California's Park Fire became the fourth-largest wildfire in state history, burning over 429,000 acres.
Spain's Valencia region faced catastrophic flooding from the DANA weather phenomenon, claiming over 230 lives.

conclusion.title: Extreme Weather Intensifies
conclusion.text: 2024 continued the trend of increasing weather extremes, with record-breaking fires and unprecedented flooding events.

australian_heat_2025.title: Australian Summer Heat Wave 2025
australian_heat_2025.description: The ongoing extreme heat affecting Australia in early 2025

steps.narration: Australia faces another extreme summer with temperatures exceeding 40°C across vast regions of the continent.

conclusion.title: Ongoing Climate Challenges
conclusion.text: Australia continues to experience intense heat waves, highlighting the urgent need for climate adaptation strategies.
